fr.sii.ogham.core.builder.mimetype

Class SimpleTikaBuilder<P>

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sii.ogham.core.fluent.AbstractParent<P>
      • fr.sii.ogham.core.builder.mimetype.SimpleTikaBuilder<P>
  • Type Parameters:
    P - the type of the parent builder (when calling AbstractParent.and() method)
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Builder<MimeTypeProvider>, TikaBuilder<P>, Parent<P>

    public class SimpleTikaBuilder<P>
extends AbstractParent<P>
implements TikaBuilder<P>
    Instantites and configures the TikaProvider:
    • If a custom Tika instance has been provided, then use it directly
    • If no custom Tika instance has been provided, then use the default one: new Tika() (see TikaConfig.getDefaultConfig())
    • Tika may be in some conditions not enough accurate. In this case, it will return application/octet-stream mimetype. If failIfOctetStream(Boolean) is set to true, then if Tika returns an application/octet-stream, it will throw an exception. The purpose is to let another MimeTypeProvider implementation take over and try to make a better detection.
    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet

      • SimpleTikaBuilder

        public SimpleTikaBuilder(P parent,
                         BuildContext buildContext)
        Initializes the builder with the parent instance (used by the AbstractParent.and() method) and the EnvironmentBuilder. The EnvironmentBuilder is used to evaluate property values when build() is called.
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent instance
        buildContext - used to evaluate property values

        Provide custom Tika instance.

        This can be useful if the default instance doesn't fit your needs. This lets you complete control on Tika configuration.

      • failIfOctetStream

        public TikaBuilder<P> failIfOctetStream(Boolean fail)
        Description copied from interface: TikaBuilder
        If Tika detection returns an application/octet-stream, it may means that detection was not enough accurate. In order to try other registered implementations that are able to detect mimetypes, you can set this to true.

        The value set using this method takes precedence over any property and default value configured using TikaBuilder.failIfOctetStream(). 

         .failIfOctetStream(false)
 .failIfOctetStream()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(true)
 
         .failIfOctetStream(false)
 .failIfOctetStream()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(true)
        In both cases, failIfOctetStream(false) is used.

        If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.

        If null value is set, it is like not setting a value at all. The property/default value configuration is applied.

        Specified by:
        failIfOctetStream in interface TikaBuilder<P>
        Parameters:
        fail - true to fail if mimetype returned by Tika is application/octet-stream, if false then application/octet-stream is used
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • failIfOctetStream

        public ConfigurationValueBuilder<TikaBuilder<P>,Boolean> failIfOctetStream()
        Description copied from interface: TikaBuilder
        If Tika detection returns an application/octet-stream, it may means that detection was not enough accurate. In order to try other registered implementations that are able to detect mimetypes, you can set this to true.

        This method is mainly used by Configurers to register some property keys and/or a default value. The aim is to let developer be able to externalize its configuration (using system properties, configuration file or anything else). If the developer doesn't configure any value for the registered properties, the default value is used (if set). 

         .failIfOctetStream()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(true)

        Non-null value set using TikaBuilder.failIfOctetStream(Boolean) takes precedence over property values and default value. 

         .failIfOctetStream(false)
 .failIfOctetStream()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(true)
        The value false is used regardless of the value of the properties and default value.

        See ConfigurationValueBuilder for more information.

        Specified by:
        failIfOctetStream in interface TikaBuilder<P>
        Returns:
        the builder to configure property keys/default value
